description: Discovery rule tolls statute of limitations
facts: Surgeon negligently left a sponge inside patient
Patient discovered the sponge in 2020 when symptoms appeared
Statute of limitations for medical malpractice is 2 years
Lawsuit filed in 2021, one year after discovery
asp_facts: claim(c1). claim_type(c1, statute_of_limitations). plaintiff(c1, patient). defendant(c1, surgeon). injury_year(c1, 2017). discovery_year(c1, 2020). filing_year(c1, 2021). limitations_period_years(c1, 2). discovery_rule(c1, yes). latent_injury(c1, yes). claim_timely(c1, yes).
question: Is the medical malpractice claim time-barred?
rationale: Under the discovery rule, the statute of limitations begins running when the plaintiff discovers (or reasonably should have discovered) the injury. The patient discovered the sponge in 2020 and filed within 2 years, so the claim is timely.
